title: Translate Negation Sentences
instruction: Translate these sentences from classical Buddhist texts. Pay attention to the negation particles མི and མ.

questions.correctAnswer: Form does not arise and does not cease.

breakdown.subject: གཟུགས (form)
breakdown.negation1: མི་སྐྱེ (does not arise — མི + present verb)
breakdown.negation2: མི་འགག (does not cease — མི + present verb)

questions.transliteration: sgrib pa med pas 'jigs pa med
questions.correctAnswer: Because there is no obscuration, there is no fear.

breakdown.cause: སྒྲིབ་པ་མེད་པས (because there is no obscuration — མེད + causal)

questions.transliteration: nyon mongs kyi dbang du ma song
questions.correctAnswer: Do not fall under the power of the afflictions!

breakdown.verb: མ་སོང (do not go! — མ + imperative prohibition)

correctFeedback: Excellent! You correctly identified the negation patterns in these classical sentences.
incorrectFeedback: Review the negation particles: མི negates present/future verbs, མ negates past verbs and forms prohibitions, མེད means 'does not exist'.
